content.description:
This is a nice little slab in front of the Fourth Triangle. Doing this 50 foot slab into

Best Hamster Ever

makes for a nice, long scramble.
content.location: On the far right side of the Front Triangle on a lower piece of rock.

content.description: Start on a low-angle slab, and head for the left side of a large overhang. Clip the first bolt above the overhang, and step delicately onto the slab above.  Moving through another small overlap above on funky underclings and pinches brings you to a final easy slab and the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts plus a 2-bolt anchor (and a 2-bolt belay anchor at the base).
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the Front Triangle heading directly up to the main anchors from which you probably rappelled in.

content.description:
No, not THAT

Kinky Reggae

in Clear Creek Canyon but a fun route that stays consistent at the grade for much of its modest length. This would make a great first pitch to link with

Joy of My World

(to make Kinky Joy?).

Start with an overhanging, right-leaning crack, and transition to some steep, chunky overlaps. Climb weird, awkward, fun moves all the way through to a final bolt on the slab above. At that point, either move left to the last bolt on

Reggaeton

for an easier finish or run it out straight up on the thin face.
content.protection: 4 bolts (or 5) to a 2-bolt anchor (and a 2-bolt belay anchor at the base).
content.location: This is the righthand route of the two that share the anchors just below the ramp.

content.description:
A steep dish leads to a high horizontal jug rail and a pull up onto the slabby face above.  The final section to the anchors hides a few more stout moves on thin holds.  The top anchors are a solid body length below the ledge on top and therefore are not easily accessed from above. The bottom of the route can be accessed by walking to the right up a ramp from the bottom of

Reggaeton

/

Kinky Reggae

, on the left side of the Front Triangle.

There is a TR variation to the left of the regular start-- it goes up through an overhanging, broken section that might be able to be led on gear, 5.10ish.
content.location:
On the right side of the Front Triangle, start on a ramp that can be accessed from the base of the left side routes,

Reggaeton

/

Kinky Reggae

.
